title: Gwensleepstudyresultsletter2017-03-27
201713 Gwen profile bed
Fwd: EHCP for Gwen Vials Moore
content:
Sent from my iPhone

Begin forwarded message:

From: Cora Vials Moore <cora.vialsmoore@gmail.com>
Date: 21 July 2020 at 08:23:06 BST
To: Adam Moore <moore.adam@gmail.com>, admin@stnicholas.sefton.org.uk
Subject: EHCP for Gwen Vials Moore

﻿
Hi There

Please find attached our track changed EHCP and the parent / person profile for Gwen. Please note that the table in the EHCP document with reference to our meeting was written before the meeting took place. The table needed updating generally owing to Gwen's progress. Apologies for the delays that these very difficult times have caused  

Note that without ever having sight of the draft for submission and with such a long gap in time between professional evaluation and subsequent input into the document (Gwen will have spent 7 months home learning by the time she returns to school in September), we will not be supporting it and would instead prefer a full formal review, feeding into an informed update with new health / assessments as soon as possible in the new term to cover this important statutory document. As we are sure you appreciate we could not support any document which we have not seen. On the last occasion we were sent a draft which we then agreed with School. We appreciate that as it is the last day of term so this is not possible. 

As discussed on the phone Gwen is due an Ed Psych review. We appreciate you having put her on the school list for when it is suitable/possible to do this.

Best

Cora and Adam

As we are sure you appreciate we could not support any document which we have not seen. On the last occasion we were sent a draft which we then agreed with School. We appreciate that as it is the last day of term so this is not possible.As discussed on the phone Gwen is due an Ed Psych review. We appreciate you having put her on the school list for when it is suitable/possible to do this.BestCora and Adam

Dr Adam Vials Moore (@adam__moore)
https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2085-1908

Begin forwarded message:

From: Robertson Janice <Janice.Robertson@alderhey.nhs.uk>
Date: 12 January 2023 at 09:47:18 GMT
To: Adam Vials Moore <moore.adam@gmail.com>, Cora Vials Moore <cora.vialsmoore@gmail.com>
Subject: RE: Gwen - letter

﻿Hi

Please find attached the flight letter for Gwen

Kind regards

Janice

-----Original Message-----
From: Adam Vials Moore <moore.adam@gmail.com>
Sent: 11 January 2023 08:51
To: Robertson Janice <Janice.Robertson@alderhey.nhs.uk>; Cora Vials Moore <Cora.vialsmoore@gmail.com>
Subject: Gwen - letter and oxygen nurse

Hi Janice!

Well - that was an "exciting" time last night

First of all thank you so much for everyone for arranging everything so quickly

Obviously not quite what we were hoping for but on we go

We'd be so grateful if the letter from Dr Halfhide could be sent to both Cora and myself asap this morning to allow us to deal with the providers and also contact from the oxygen nurse as Phil said last night - we're completely on new territory as Claire has always said oxygen for Gwen is hospital only so don't have the usual network / knowledge...

I'm driving to and from my own clinic this morning so if you can call Cora we'd really appreciate it

Cora 07931540482

Thanks again

Adam

title: GVM_Medical_Report_J.pdf
Gwen care plans / reports
content:
﻿
﻿ On 24 May 2022, at 16:55, Weatherall Laura <Laura.Weatherall@alderhey.nhs.uk> wrote:

﻿

Hi Adam/Cora,

 

I am sorry to hear re the difficulties for yourselves and Gwen. I am happy to provide a letter detailing the reasonable adjustments that Gwen has required on recent stays if that is useful. Have you spoken to Gwen’s EHCP lead about these proposed changes (apologies if daft question).

 

BW,

Laura

Laura Weatherall

Acute Liaison Learning Disability Nurse/Team Lead

Alder Hey Children's NHS Foundation Trust

07976797068

 

 

 

 

From: Adam Vials Moore <moore.adam@gmail.com>
Sent: 24 May 2022 16:42
To: Weatherall Laura <Laura.Weatherall@alderhey.nhs.uk>
Cc: Cora Vials Moore <cora.vialsmoore@gmail.com>
Subject: Gwen Vials Moore - support needs 

 

Hi Laura  

 

We have just had the annual EHCP review meeting with school. Before the meeting formally started, school informed us that, without prior consultation or seeking of views, they intended to remove Gwen’s 121 provision because they are creating a hub with one specialist teacher and two teaching assistants to 8 or more students. 

 

We're really concerned about this change - especially as it was planned without input from either medics nor ourselves. 

 

We are concerned that her 1:1 support has always been based on medical need - and supported through plans put in place by professionals in a numbers of settings, including at Claire House (who recently increased her to a 2:1 when out of setting).  

 

Gwen not only has Downs Syndrome but is on the pathway for ASD and ADHD. It is recorded both by school and home in her adhd paperwork that Gwen does not meet her potential as things are owing to her behaviours. Her behaviours are fundamentally unsafe and she requires 1:1 supervision at all times - in fact she gets social care provision for a 2:1 at home (50 hours a week at a higher hourly rate which is almost unheard of). 


While in hospital she had to be sedated in recovery. While on the ward she was non compliant with staff and it took groups of staff to get basic things done owing to non compliance. If we left, which was rare owing to Gwen’s behaviours, a member of staff would stay with her owing to her behaviours and lack of awareness in harming herself.  

Gwen was discharged against medical advice (owing to hoist provision), but with medical support, because she was better at home, although her behaviours are difficult everywhere she is better in routine.  

She required input from the ASD team and learning difficulties lead as an inpatient but would not comply with them.  

As an outpatient She went through several cast changes, opened her wound with her fingernail, snapped her brace and the new brace which was fitted yesterday is also now broken and we are currently trying to get hold of orthotics again. 

Gwen does not care about pain and will inflict it on herself in a sensory seeking manner and will not report it. Gwen has never been classed as medically safe without a 121 and this increases with age. A 121 was supported initially by Dr Halfhide many years ago and Gwendolyn’s behaviours have since deteriorated as she has grown. Her medical needs have not improved with age, albeit her breathing improved she still has desaturations and positional issues, and is overdue a sleep study. Claire House Childrens Hospice have her as a 221 if she goes out and 121 in the hospice at all times. They would never seem group supervision for Gwen in their setting as enough. 

 

Given you and your teams support on her recent admissions and awareness of her behaviour, we hoped you could provide a short report / update recommending continued 1:1 provision. Happy to discuss any details over a call

 

Adam & Cora  

07712553049  



Dr Adam Vials Moore (@adam__moore) 

https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2085-1908

﻿


 
 


Dr Adam Vials Moore (@adam__moore)
https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2085-1908

I am happy to provide a letter detailing the reasonable adjustments that Gwen has required on recent stays if that is useful.
